--- title: "5.3 — Antitrust III: The Hipsters — Class Content" execute: freeze: auto --- ::: {.cell} ::: ::: {.callout-note appearance=minimal} # Meeting Date *Thursday, April 27, 2023* ::: ## Overview Today we begin our look at the economics of antitrust, which will take several class periods. Today we cover the kinds of antitrust claims and their remedies today, the history of the major antitrust laws (their origins, evolution, interpretation, and some major court cases), as well as a broad history of economic thought on antitrust. ## Readings ### Recommended Readings: - [ David, 1985, "Clio and the Economics of QWERTY"](/readings/David-1985.pdf) - [ Khan, 2017, "Amazon's Antitrust Paradox"](/readings/Khan-2017.pdf) - [ Leibowitz and Margolis, 1990, "The Fable of the Keys"](/readings/Leibowitz-Margolis-1990.pdf) - [ Khan, 2017, "Amazon's Antitrust Paradox"](https://www.yalelawjournal.org/note/amazons-antitrust-paradox) - [ WSJ (Apr 23, 2020): "Amazon Scooped Up Data From Its Own Sellers to Launch Competing Products"](https://www.wsj.com/articles/amazon-scooped-up-data-from-its-own-sellers-to-launch-competing-products-11587650015) - [ BBC: Why we can’t give up this odd way of typing](https://www.bbc.com/worklife/article/20180521-why-we-cant-give-up-this-odd-way-of-typing) - [ Snopes: Are U.S. Railroad Gauges Based on Roman Chariots?](https://www.snopes.com/fact-check/railroad-gauge-chariots/) - [ *NPR Planet Money*: "Antitrust 1: Standard Oil"](https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2019/02/15/695131832/antitrust-1-standard-oil) - [ *NPR Planet Money*: "Antitrust 2: The Paradox"](https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2019/02/20/696342011/antitrust-2-the-paradox) - [ *NPR Planet Money*: "Antitrust 3: Big Tech"](https://www.npr.org/sections/money/2019/02/22/697170790/antitrust-3-big-tech) - [ *Capitalisn't*: "Antitrust Pt 1: The Establishment"](https://www.capitalisnt.com/episodes/a2603962) - [ *Capitalisn't*: "Antitrust Pt 2: The Populists"](https://www.capitalisnt.com/episodes/bd103ef4) - [ *Capitalisn't*: "Antitrust Pt 3: The Europeans"](https://www.capitalisnt.com/episodes/c5eb2438) - [ *Capitalisn't*: "Antitrust-Isn't: The Story Of Declining Enforcement In America"](https://www.capitalisnt.com/episodes/antitrust-isnt-the-story-of-declining-enforcement-in-america) - [ *Capitalisn't*: "Microsoft 1998 vs Google 2020: Antitrust and Big Tech"](https://www.capitalisnt.com/episodes/microsoft-1998-vs-google-2020-antitrust-and-big-tech) ## Slides Below, you can find the slides in two formats. Clicking the image will bring you to the html version of the slides in a new tab. The lower button will allow you to download a PDF version of the slides. ::: callout-tip You can type h to see a special list of viewing options, and type o for an outline view of all the slides. ::: I suggest printing the slides beforehand and using them to take additional notes in class (*not everything* is in the slides)!
